This is the most basic and most widely used type of tapered roller bearing. It consists of two main separable parts: the cone (inner ring) assembly and the cup (outer ring). It is typically mounted in opposing pairs on a shaft

Matched tapered roller bearings arranged face-to-face (X-arrangement, load lines diverge towards the bearing axis) accommodate high radial loads and axial loads in both directions. The precision manufactured intermediate ring between the outer rings enables a defined internal clearance or preload to be achieved when mounted. Matched tapered roller bearings are typically used in gearboxes, hoisting equipment, rolling mills, and machines in the mining industry.
High radial load carrying capacity
Designed for axial loads in both directions
Relatively high stiffness
Surface finish on the contact surfaces of the rollers and raceways that enhances operational reliability

Name: F-586062.ZL
description: The FAG F-586062.ZL, crafted by Schaeffler Group in Germany, is a high-performance cylindrical roller bearing engineered for railway axlebox assemblies. Designed to withstand heavy radial and axial loads, this bearing ensures reliable, maintenance-free operation in demanding rail environments, including trains, trams, and subways.

Name: SL04-5018
description: The SL04-5018NR NTN is a full-complement double-row cylindrical roller bearing. This bearing has a particularly high radial load capacity. The design consists of a solid inner and outer ring with a double row of cylindrical rollers. These rolling elements are guided between flanges. Since there is no cage, a maximum number of rollers can be used. This type of bearing is therefore suitable for very heavy loads where lower rotational speeds are involved.

Name: SL18-3016
description: The SL183016 is a single-row, full-complement cylinder bearing. This bearing type has a solid outer and inner ring and a high number of cylindrical rollers. These rollers are guided between the ribs of the rings. Since there is no cage, the maximum number of rolls can be used. As a result, these bearings can support very high radial loads. However, the maximum speed is lower than the speed of cylindrical roller bearings with cages. Single-row full-complement cylindrical roller bearings can also support axial forces in one direction. They are used as support bearings. Support bearings allow axial displacement of the shaft relative to the housing in one direction. The shaft is located axially in the other direction.

Name: NNF5011-2LS-V
description: Double row full complement cylindrical roller bearings incorporate a maximum number of rollers and are therefore suitable for very heavy radial loads in combination with moderate speeds. Having three flanges on the two-piece inner ring and one central flange on the outer ring, NNF design bearings can locate the shaft axially in both directions. Two snap ring grooves in the outer ring simplify mounting and save space axially.

The 5408A SKF is a double-row angular contact ball bearing with solid inner- and outer rings. The design of this bearing type resembles two single-row angular contact ball bearings in O-arrangement but is slightly narrower. Double-row angular contact ball bearings can support high radial forces and axial forces in both directions. The greater the contact angle, the greater the axial load capacity of the bearing.

description:
G2
Standard Quality Class For Needles

High radial and axial load carrying capacity
Accommodate axial loads in one direction
Low friction and long service life
Separable and interchangeable components

The 7328B NSK is a single row angular contact bearing. These bearings have solid inner- and outer rings. They owe their name to the contact angle that is created as the raceways of the inner and outer rings are offset from each other along the bearing axis. The bearing rings have one high and one low shoulder. Thanks to the low shoulder, a large number of balls can be incorporated in the bearing. Single row angular contact bearings can support high radial forces and axial forces in one direction. The greater the contact angle, the greater the axial load capacity of the bearing.

They accommodate radial and axial loads in both directions, are easy to mount, and require less maintenance than many other bearing types.

Self-aligning ball bearings have two rows of balls, a common sphered raceway in the outer ring and two deep uninterrupted raceway grooves in the inner ring. They are insensitive to angular misalignment of the shaft relative to the housing, which can be caused, for example, by shaft deflection.
Accommodate static and dynamic misalignment
Excellent high-speed performance
Excellent light load performance
Low friction

HJ-729636 designates the outer ring assembly of a heavy-duty needle roller bearing .
IR-607236 designates the inner ring assembly for that bearing. 
Combined as HJ-729636 + IR-607236, they form a complete single-row heavy duty needle roller bearing

Single row tapered roller bearings are designed to accommodate combined radial and axial loads and provide low friction during operation. The inner ring, with rollers and cage, can be mounted separately from the outer ring. These separable and interchangeable components facilitate mounting, dismounting and maintenance. By mounting one single row tapered roller bearing against another and applying a preload, a rigid bearing application can be achieved.

Matched tapered roller bearings arranged face-to-face (X-arrangement, load lines diverge towards the bearing axis) accommodate high radial loads and axial loads in both directions. The precision manufactured intermediate ring between the outer rings enables a defined internal clearance or preload to be achieved when mounted. Matched tapered roller bearings are typically used in gearboxes, hoisting equipment, rolling mills, and machines in the mining industry.
High radial load carrying capacity
Designed for axial loads in both directions
Relatively high stiffness
Surface finish on the contact surfaces of the rollers and raceways that enhances operational reliability

description:
Radial spherical plain bearings are designed to accommodate radial and combined radial and axial loads, and also misalignment. Designed for radial and combined radial and axial loads
Suitable for heavy static, alternating or impact loads

Single direction thrust ball bearing with sphered housing washer
Single direction thrust ball bearings, with sphered housing washer, can accommodate axial loads in one direction. They must not be subjected to any radial load. Many of the components are interchangeable. The shaft washers have a ground bore that enables an interference fit. The sphered housing washers can accommodate initial misalignment when configured correctly with a sphered seat washer or a machine component with a sphered surface.
Separable design facilitates mounting/dismounting and maintenance inspections

Single row cylindrical roller thrust bearings are designed to accommodate heavy axial loads and peak loads in one direction, but not radial loads. They provide a high degree of stiffness and require little axial space. They are mainly used in applications where thrust ball bearings do not have sufficient load carrying capacity. An important feature is the separable design, which facilitates mounting and enables the bearing components to be interchanged.
High axial load carrying capacity
High stiffness
Long service life
Require little axial space
Separable design

The 842/832 Timken is a single-row tapered roller bearing. This bearing type gets its name from the tapered rollers between the inner and outer rings. The raceways are conical. This design allows these versatile bearings to accommodate combined loads. They support high radial and axial loads (in one direction). The greater the contact angle, the greater the axial load capacity.

The 842/832 Timken is easy to (dis)assemble as it is a combination of a cup and a cone. The cone unit consists of an inner ring with cage and roller set. The cup is the outer ring. Single-row tapered roller bearings have an open design. Because of the internal construction, they must be mounted in mirror-image arrangement together with a second tapered roller bearing. Paired bearing sets can also be applied in X, O, or tandem arrangements.

Spherical roller thrust bearings accommodate very heavy axial and considerable radial loads. They have the highest load rating of all thrust bearings, enabling compact, high power density bearing arrangements. By combining two or more spherical roller thrust bearings, it is possible to create a bearing arrangement that is either self-aligning, allowing misalignment of the shaft, or very stiff.
High load carrying capacity
Can accommodate combined loads
Allow misalignment or create very stiff bearing arrangements
Long service life and low friction
Separable design

Name: NU205
description:
Single row cylindrical roller bearing, NU design
Single row cylindrical roller bearings are designed to accommodate high radial loads in combination with high speeds. Having two integral flanges on the outer ring and no flanges on the inner ring, NU design bearings can accommodate axial displacement in both directions. An important feature is the separable design, which facilitates mounting and enables the bearing components to be interchanged.
High radial load carrying capacity
Low friction
Long service life
Accommodate axial displacement in both directions
Separable design

Spherical roller thrust bearings accommodate very heavy axial and considerable radial loads. They have the highest load rating of all thrust bearings, enabling compact, high power density bearing arrangements. By combining two or more spherical roller thrust bearings, it is possible to create a bearing arrangement that is either self-aligning, allowing misalignment of the shaft, or very stiff.

Name: SL18 2926 A
description: The SL18-2926 INA is a single-row, full-complement cylinder bearing. This bearing type has a solid outer and inner ring and a high number of cylindrical rollers. These rollers are guided between the ribs of the rings. Since there is no cage, the maximum number of rolls can be used. As a result, these bearings can support very high radial loads. However, the maximum speed is lower than the speed of cylindrical roller bearings with cages. Single-row full-complement cylindrical roller bearings can also support axial forces in one direction. They are used as support bearings. Support bearings allow axial displacement of the shaft relative to the housing in one direction. The shaft is located axially in the other direction.

Name: SL02 4928 A
description: The SL18-2926 INA is a single-row, full-complement cylinder bearing. This bearing type has a solid outer and inner ring and a high number of cylindrical rollers. Name: SLX130X200X114
description: The SL04-5018NR NTN is a full-complement double-row cylindrical roller bearing. This bearing has a particularly high radial load capacity. The design consists of a solid inner and outer ring with a double row of cylindrical rollers. These rolling elements are guided between flanges. Since there is no cage, a maximum number of rollers can be used. This type of bearing is therefore suitable for very heavy loads where lower rotational speeds are involved.

Name: HK/3518L
description:
Drawn cup needle roller bearings are typically used in applications where the housing bore cannot be used as a raceway for a needle roller and cage assembly, but where a very compact and economical bearing arrangement is required. Owing to their large number of rollers, the bearings have a high load carrying capacity and stiffness. The integral sealing can significantly prolong bearing service life because it keeps lubricant in the bearings and contaminants out. Sealed bearings are delivered with an initial grease fill.
High radial load carrying capacity
High stiffness
Very low cross-sectional height
Sealed for increased reliability

Name: LRJA2.1/2
description: The LRJA 2 1/2 is a specific type of Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing designed using imperial (inch) measurements. It is primarily associated with the manufacturer RHP (Ransome Hoffmann Pollard)These bearings are designed to handle heavy radial loads and are characterized by their "Light" duty series designation (LRJ).

Name: LRJ1.1/8
description: The LRJ 1 1/8 (often branded as R&M or RHP) is a Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing designed with imperial (inch) dimensions. Part of the "Light" series (LRJ), it is built to handle heavy radial loads in high-speed applications while maintaining a relatively slim profile.

Name: CRL 13A
description: The CRL 13A (often marked as SKEFKO or SKF) is an imperial-sized Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing from the "Light" series. SKEFKO was the historical name for SKF's UK manufacturing division, so you will often see these bearings on vintage or British-made industrial machinery.The CRL 13A is designed for high radial loads and features a separable design for easier installation.

Name: CRL 28A
description: The CRL 28A is frequently used in heavy-duty machinery where a large bore and high radial capacity are required

Name: CRM 10
description: The CRM 10 is designed for robust industrial applications that require high radial stiffness.

Name: CRM 18A
description: The CRM 18A is a heavy-duty component commonly found in gearboxes, mining equipment, and large electric motors.

Name: CRM 36
description: The CRM 36A (often marked as SKF or SKEFKO) is a heavy-duty Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing from the "Medium" (CRM) series. This is a very large imperial-sized bearing designed for industrial equipment requiring extreme radial load support and stiffness.The CRM 36A features a 4.5-inch bore and is built for heavy machinery.

Name: MMRJ 1.1/4 C3
description: The MMRJ 1 1/4 C3 is a heavy-duty, imperial-sized Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing. This specific variant includes a C3 internal clearance, meaning it has more internal "play" than a standard bearing to allow for heat expansion during high-speed or high-temperature operation.

Name: MJT2.1/4
description:
Full complement CARB toroidal roller bearing
CARB toroidal roller bearings are unique: as well as accommodating misalignment without increased stress levels, they also provide frictionless axial movement within the bearing in the non-locating position in

Name: M19CDS 2
description: The M19CDS 2 (often listed as M-19-CDS) is a large, imperial-sized Four-Point Contact Ball Bearing (alternatively classified as a Split Inner Ring Angular Contact bearing) from the Hoffmann "Medium" series.It is a specialized bearing designed to handle heavy radial loads and axial thrust in both directions, making it a common choice for high-precision industrial machinery.This bearing is built with heavy-duty dimensions typical of the Hoffmann

Name: MRJ1.3/4
description: The MRJ 1 3/4 (often listed as MRJ 1.3/4) is a Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing designed with imperial (inch) dimensions. Part of the Medium Series (MRJ), it is built for applications that involve heavy radial loads and high-speed operation.

Name: MA 1313
description: The MA1313 is a heavy-duty Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing component manufactured by Bower (part of the NTN Corporation). In the Bower system, the "MA" prefix typically refers to the inner ring as a separable component of a larger "M" series cylindrical roller bearing assembly.

Name: MRJ4.1/4
description: The MRJ 4 1/4 (often written as MRJ 4.1/4) is a large Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing from the "Medium" (MRJ) series. It is an imperial-dimensioned bearing designed to carry exceptionally heavy radial loads, commonly found in heavy industrial machinery, large electric motors, and maritime equipment.

Name: MU1308
description: The MU1308TM is a Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing designed for medium-duty industrial applications. It is part of the 1300 seriesMU1308TM is a full-complement bearing, meaning it does not have a cage (retainer). This allows for a maximum number of rollers to be packed into the bearing, providing the highest possible load capacity for its size.This bearing uses a combination of metric dimensions for its main structure and is often found in heavy-duty vehicle pinion assemblies and industrial gearboxes.

Name: MU5308TM
description: The MU5308 is a specialized Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing from the "Medium" (5300) seriesis engineered for applications requiring high radial load capacity in a compact, wide-width design.The MU5308 is classified as a "Wide" Medium series bearing, offering more surface area for the rollers than standard-width series.

Name: MU5213TV
description: The MU5213TV is a specialized Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing from the Link-Belt (Regal Rexnord) and Bower (NTN) brand lines. It is part of the "Light" weight series (5200), but it features a Wide Width design, allowing it to handle significant radial loads in applications like heavy-duty truck transmissions, gearboxes, and engineering machinery.The MU5213TV is a high-capacity bearing designed with a "T" configuration in the outer ring.

Name: M1313EAHX
description:
The M1313EAHX is a high-capacity Single Row Cylindrical Roller Bearing component, primarily associated with  Link-Belt (Regal Rexnord).

It is often sold specifically as the Outer Ring and Roller Assembly (OR&RA). This means it is a "separable" component designed to be used with a matching inner ring (like the MA1313 or MR1313) or directly on a hardened and ground shaft.

Name: MU5212TV
description: it features a Wide Width design, which allows it to provide significantly higher load ratings than standard-width bearings of the same bore diameter.The MU5212TV is a metric-dimensioned bearing commonly used in high-stress industrial applications like pumps, transmissions, and heavy machinery.

Name: MR40
description: The MR 40 is a heavy-duty, machined-race needle roller bearing (Cagerol series), most commonly manufactured by McGill (a brand of Regal Rexnord). It is an inch-series bearing typically used in high-load industrial applications where space is limited.The MR 40 is a "no-inner-ring" bearing, meaning it is designed to run directly on a hardened shaft

Name: MR 52
description: The MR 52 is a heavy-duty, machined-race needle roller bearing from the McGill Cagerol series. It is designed to handle high radial loads in a compact design and is typically used in industrial machinery, gearboxes, and heavy equipment.

Name: MR 72
description: The MR 72 bearing is part of the same heavy-duty McGill Cagerol needle roller bearing series as the previous ones you asked about. It is an inch-series bearing with a larger diameter and significantly higher weight.

Name: RNA4822+ IR-LRT11012030
description: The bearing assembly shown in your image, RNA4822 + IR-LRT11012030, is a metric needle roller bearing combination. The RNA4822 is the outer ring and cage assembly, while the LRT11012030 is the matching inner ring.

Name: RNA4908
description: The RNA 4908 is a metric, single-row machined needle roller bearing that is designed to be used without an inner ring. It is ideal for applications with limited radial space where the shaft itself can be hardened and ground to act as the raceway.

Name: RLS 10
description:
Single row deep groove ball bearings are particularly versatile, have low friction and are optimized for low noise and low vibration, which enables high rotational speeds. They accommodate radial and axial loads in both directions, are easy to mount, and require less maintenance than many other bearing types.
Simple, versatile and robust design
Low friction
High-speed capability
Accommodate radial and axial loads in both directions
Require little maintenance

Name: RLS14
description: The RLS 14 is an inch-series, single-row deep groove ball bearing. As part of the "Regular Light Series," it is designed to handle radial loads and moderate axial loads in both directions, common in industrial machinery and automotive components built to imperial standards.

Name: RLS 32M
description: The RLS 32 M is a large, single-row deep groove ball bearing from the inch-series (Imperial) range. The "M" suffix specifically denotes that the bearing features a machined brass (bronze) cage, which is a heavy-duty upgrade over the standard sheet steel cage.

Name: RLS 38 C3
description: The RLS 38 C3 is a large, single-row deep groove ball bearing following the inch-series (Imperial) standard. The "C3" suffix indicates that the bearing has greater than normal internal radial clearance, making it ideal for high-speed applications or environments with significant heat.

Name: RMS 7
description: The RMS 7 ZZ is an inch-series (Imperial), single-row deep groove ball bearing. The "RMS" prefix stands for Regular Medium Series, which is a heavier-duty version of the RLS (Regular Light Series) bearings we previously discussed.The ZZ (or 2Z) suffix indicates that the bearing is equipped with metal shields on both sides

Name: RMS 10
description: The RMS 10 is a single-row deep groove ball bearing from the Regular Medium Series (Imperial/Inch series). It is the heavier-duty counterpart to the RLS 10; while both have the same bore diameter, the RMS 10 is physically larger and heavier to handle significantly higher loads.

Name: RMS12
description: The RMS 12 is a single-row deep groove ball bearing from the Regular Medium Series (Imperial/Inch series). Like the other RMS bearings we've discussed, it is built with a thicker cross-section and larger balls than the "Light" (RLS) series, allowing it to support much higher radial and axial loads.

Name: RMS 13
description: The RMS 13 is a single-row deep groove ball bearing from the Regular Medium Series (Imperial/Inch series). It is designed to handle significantly higher radial and axial loads than the "Light" (RLS) series with the same bore size.

Name: RMS 19.1/2
description:
The RMS 19 1/2 in its cylindrical roller configuration is a heavy-duty imperial bearing. In the Hoffmann nomenclature, "RMS" (Regular Medium Series) indicates a cylindrical roller design, whereas "MS" typically refers to the ball bearing version.The RMS 19 1/2 Hoffmann (also frequently listed under the interchange MS 19 1/2) is a heavy-duty, inch-series bearing.

There are two primary types of this bearing: a Deep Groove Ball Bearing (MS series) and a Cylindrical Roller Bearing (RMS series). In the Hoffmann catalog, these often share the same boundary dimensions but differ in internal construction and weight.

Name: RMS 26
description: The RMS 26 is a heavy-duty, single-row deep groove ball bearing from the Imperial (inch-series) Regular Medium Series. As a "Medium Series" bearing, it has a significantly thicker cross-section and larger rolling elements than the "Light Series" (RLS 26), allowing it to handle much higher loads.

Name: RMS 42
description: The RMS 42 is a very large, single-row deep groove ball bearing from the Imperial (inch-series) Regular Medium Series. In the RMS hierarchy, this is one of the "heavyweight" sizes, typically found in massive industrial gearboxes, heavy-duty mixers, or large rotating machinery where high load-carrying capacity is required.

Name: LDJ65K
description: The LDJ65K is a double-row angular contact ball bearing from the Light Imperial/Metric hybrid series. It is a specialized vintage-style bearing, originally produced by manufacturers like R&M (Ransome & Marles) and RHP

Name: LDJ70K
description: The LDJ70K is a double-row angular contact ball bearing from the Light Imperial/Metric hybrid series. Much like the LDJ65K, it features metric diameters (bore and OD) but uses an imperial (inch) width, a common characteristic of vintage British-manufactured bearings from R&M and RHP.

Name: LM249747NW-LM249710CD
description: The LM249747NW - LM249710CD is a high-capacity, double-row tapered roller bearing assembly (inch-series), manufactured primarily by Timken. This specific configuration is part of the TDO (Tapered Double Outer) family, designed to handle extreme radial loads and axial (thrust) loads from both directions.

Name: NKIB 5907 NA
description:
The NKIB 5907 NA is a high-performance combined needle roller / angular contact ball bearing. It is designed for applications where space is limited but the bearing must handle both heavy radial loads and double-direction axial (thrust) loads.

The "NKIB" designation specifically means this bearing can accommodate axial displacement and axial loads in both directions, unlike the "NKIA" series which only handles axial loads in one direction.Two-Part Inner Ring: The NKIB 5907 features a separable inner ring. One part is wider and carries the needle rollers, while the second part is a smaller ring that completes the angular contact ball raceway.

Name: NKI65/35-XL
description: The NKI65/35-XL is a single-row needle roller bearing with a machined outer ring and an inner ring. The "XL" suffix stands for X-life, which is the premium quality standard from INA (Schaeffler), offering higher load ratings and longer service life compared to standard designs.

Name: NKIA 5908
description: The NKIA 5908 is a high-performance combined needle roller / angular contact ball bearing. Unlike the "NKIB" series which handles axial loads in two directions, the "NKIA" series is designed to accommodate heavy radial loads and light axial (thrust) loads in one direction only.Single-Direction Location: Because it uses an angular contact ball component, it locates the shaft in one direction. For locating a shaft in both directions, two bearings must be mounted back-to-back.

Name: NA 6909
description: the NA 6909 is the double-row sibling to the NKIA series. It is a Machined-Ring Needle Roller Bearing with an inner ring, specifically designed for applications where you need extreme radial load capacity in a compact footprint.

Name: NAS5009 ZZNR
description:
The NAS 5009 ZZNR is a specialized, heavy-duty Double Row Full-Complement Cylindrical Roller Bearing, most commonly manufactured by IKO (Nippon Thompson).

Unlike the previous needle bearings we discussed, "Full Complement" means this bearing has no cageit is packed with the maximum number of rollers possible to achieve an extremely high load capacity. It is specifically designed for use in sheaves (pulleys) for cranes and hoisting equipment.

Name: NA44143-NA44363D
description:
The NA44143-44363D is a specialized Double-Row Tapered Roller Bearing assembly, primarily manufactured by Timken.

It is a "TNA" (Tapered Double, Non-Adjustable) type bearing. This means it consists of two inner cones and a single "double" outer cup. Unlike standard tapered bearings, it is designed with a built-in internal clearance, so it does not require manual adjustment during installation.

Name: NA6905R
description:
The NA6905R is a Machined-Ring Needle Roller Bearing with an inner ring, primarily produced by NTN.

It is essentially a wider, heavy-duty version of the standard 25mm bore needle bearing. The "R" suffix in the NTN nomenclature typically indicates a redesigned or reinforced internal structure, often involving optimized rollers or a specific flange design for better performance.

Name: NA6915
description: The NA 6915 is a high-capacity Double-Row Needle Roller Bearing equipped with a solid machined outer ring and an inner ring. In the industry, it is known for being the "extra wide" version of the 75 mm bore series, offering nearly double the load capacity of the single-row (NA 4915) equivalent.

Name: NUP307 ET
description: The NUP 307ET is a single-row cylindrical roller bearing, primarily manufactured by NSK. It is designed to handle high radial loads and provide axial location for a shaft in both directions.

Name: N312
description:
Single row cylindrical roller bearing, N design
Single row cylindrical roller bearings are designed to accommodate high radial loads in combination with high speeds. Having two integral flanges on the inner ring and no flanges on the outer ring, N design bearings can accommodate axial displacement in both directions. An important feature is the separable design, which facilitates mounting and enables the bearing components to be interchanged.

Name: NUP211
description:
Single row cylindrical roller bearing, NUP design
Single row cylindrical roller bearings are designed to accommodate high radial loads in combination with high speeds. Having two integral flanges on the outer ring and one integral flange and one loose flange ring on the inner ring, NUP design bearings can locate the shaft axially in both directions. An important feature is the separable design, which facilitates mounting and enables the bearing components to be interchanged.

An important feature is the separable design, which facilitates mounting and enables the bearing components to be interchanged.

Name: QJ328
description:
Four-point contact ball bearing with locating slots
Four-point contact ball bearings with locating slots can accommodate high axial loads in both directions and small radial loads. They can operate at very high speeds and are more suitable than deep groove ball bearings for supporting large axial forces. The outer ring, with ball and cage assembly, can be mounted separately from the two inner ring halves. The locating slots can be used to prevent the outer ring from rotating.
High-speed capability

Name: 498FL
description: This is the most basic and most widely used type of tapered roller bearing. It consists of two main separable parts: the cone (inner ring) assembly and the cup (outer ring). It is typically mounted in opposing pairs on a shaft.

Name: 466830VAR
description: The 466830 VAR is a specialized, high-capacity single-row cylindrical roller bearing, primarily manufactured by SKF. This part is an industrial-grade component specifically engineered for heavy-duty applications such as traction motors in railway locomotives or large industrial reducers.

Name: DC-7221
description: The DC7221 is a high-performance sprag-type one-way clutch (freewheel), primarily designed by Stieber (now part of Regal Rexnord). Unlike standard ball bearings, this is a "built-in" component consisting of a cage and sprags, intended to lock and transmit torque in one direction while "freewheeling" (overrunning) in the other.

Name: NF309
description: The NF309 is a single-row cylindrical roller bearing designed to handle high radial loads. Its unique feature is the arrangement of the "ribs" (flanges) on the rings, which allows it to provide axial location for a shaft in one direction.

Name: SL18 2924 B
description: The SL18 2924 B (often marked as SL182924-B-XL) is a heavy-duty, single-row full complement cylindrical roller bearing. It is a signature product of INA (Schaeffler Group) and is designed for applications where space is limited but load requirements are extremely high.

Name: NN3032K/SP
description: The NN3032KSP is a high-precision, double-row cylindrical roller bearing typically manufactured by premium brands like SKF or FAG. It is engineered for applications requiring extreme radial rigidity and high-speed accuracy, most notably in machine tool spindles.

Name: U1222
description: The U1222 (often seen as U1222-E or MU1222) is a large, heavy-duty single-row cylindrical roller bearing. It is a "medium series" bearing designed for high radial load capacity and is commonly used in industrial gearboxes and heavy machinery.

The 7009CTYP5 is a high-precision Angular Contact Ball Bearing, specifically designed for high-speed spindles and precision machinery. This bearing is built to handle combined radial and axial loads with extreme accuracy.

Super-precision, high-capacity, single row angular contact ball bearing
These super-precision, high-capacity, single row angular contact ball bearings, with 15 contact angle, accommodate radial and axial loads acting simultaneously, where the axial load acts in one direction only. They are designed to accommodate heavy loads at relatively high speeds under low to moderate operating temperatures.
Very high running accuracy
Very high load carrying capacity
Relatively high speed and stiffness

The 7012CTRDULP3 is an ultra-high-precision, Duplex set of Angular Contact Ball Bearings. This specific configuration is a "top-tier" component, typically manufactured by RHP, and is designed for the most demanding CNC spindle applications

The 7016X3 TADUM EP7 is a specialized, super-precision Angular Contact Ball Bearing pair. This specific nomenclature is often associated with high-end brands like RHP or specialized aerospace/spindle manufacturers. It is built for extreme reliability in machine tool spindles.

The 7018 is a widely used Angular Contact Ball Bearing in the 7000 series. It is a large-bore bearing (90 mm) that balances high-load capacity with high-speed performance, commonly found in heavy-duty industrial machinery.

Super-precision, high-capacity, universally matchable single row angular contact ball bearing
These super-precision, high-capacity, single row angular contact ball bearings accommodate radial and axial loads acting simultaneously, where the axial load acts in one direction only. They are designed to accommodate heavy loads at relatively high speeds under low to moderate operating temperatures. Being universally matchable, they can be used together in arrangements to provide effective load sharing, within a predetermined preload range, without the use of shims or similar devices.
Very high running accuracy
Very high load carrying capacity
Relatively high speed and stiffness
Universally matchable

Name: 117TMP2101UPA
description: The 117TMP2101UPA is a highly specialized, super-precision Cylindrical Roller Bearing, commonly manufactured by NSK. It is part of the "TMP" series, which is specifically designed for high-performance applications like machine tool spindles and precision gearboxes where radial stiffness and high-speed accuracy are critical.

Name: KMT8
description: The KMT8 is a high-precision locking nut (also known as a precision nut) specifically designed for mounting bearings on shafts where extreme accuracy and high locking forces are required. Unlike standard lock nuts that use a washer, the KMT series uses integrated locking pins.THREAD SIZE M 40x1.5

Name: KMT10
description:
Precision lock nut with locking pins
KMT precision lock nuts are intended for applications where high precision, simple assembly and reliable locking are required. The three equally-spaced locking pins enable these lock nuts to be accurately positioned at right angles to the shaft. However, they can also be adjusted to compensate for slight angular deviations of adjacent components. Maximum axial run-out between the locating face and thread (up to size 40): 0.005 mm
No keyway required
Withstands high axial loads
Reliable, effective locking mechanism
Designed for frequent and simple installation and removal
Available for thread M 10x0.75 to M 200x3 (sizes 0 to 40) and Tr 220x4 to Tr 420x5 (sizes 44 to 84)

Name: SY20TF
description:
Pillow (plummer) block ball bearing units consist of an insert bearing mounted in a cast iron housing that can be bolted to a support surface. This variant is suitable for applications with both constant and alternating directions of rotation. It has an inner ring extended on both sides and is locked onto the shaft by tightening a set screw on the inner ring, making it easy to mount.
Attachment bolt diameter10 mm
Shaft diameter20 mm
Centre height (pillow block)33.3 mm
Housing overall width32 mm
Centre distance between bolt holes97 mm
Bearing width, total31 mm

Name: SY45TF
description: The SY45TF SKF is a housing unit. The components of this bearing and housing assembly are matched to each other for reliable operation. This complete set is ready for use and easy to install. Housings simplify the installation of the bearing and shaft. Additionally, the bearing is supported and protected by the housing. Performing maintenance becomes easier while extending the bearing's lifespan.

Name: FYTB30TF/VA201
description: These oval flanged ball bearing units are designed for high temperature applications and are compliant with ISO standards. They consist of a high temperature insert bearing, with an extended inner ring and set screw locking, and are suitable for applications where the direction of rotation is constant or alternating. The bearing is mounted in a cast iron housing, which can be bolted to a machine wall or frame. Ball bearing units can accommodate moderate initial misalignment, but normally do not permit axial displacement.
